pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:0.4.eng: The subchapter on the dark of the night

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:0.5.eng: The training rule on sitting down without asking permission

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdatipi abhinipajjatipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā visited families after the meal, and she sat down and lay down on the seats without asking permission of the owners.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.3.pli: Manussā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ hirīyamānā āsane neva abhinisīdanti na abhinipajjanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.3.eng: Because of Thullanandā, the people there had qualms,  neither sitting nor lying down.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.4.eng: They then complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdissatipi abhinipajjissatipī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.5.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā visit families after the meal, and then sit down and lie down on the seats without asking the owners for permission?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.6.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdissatipi abhinipajjissatipī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.8.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā act in this way?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdatipi abhinipajjatipī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdissatipi abhinipajjissatipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.12.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā act in this way?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun visits families after the meal, and then sits down or lies down on a seat without asking permission of the owners, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.6.eng: when the middle of the day has passed, until sunset.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.8.pli: cattāri kulāni— khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.8.eng: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.11.eng: Without asking permission of the owners:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.12.pli: yo tasmiṃ kule manusso sāmiko dātuṃ, taṃ anāpucchā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.12.eng: not having asked permission of a person in that family who is an owner and who has the authority to give.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.14.eng: a place for sitting cross-legged is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.16.eng: if she sits down on that seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.1.18.eng: if she lies down on that seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.1.pli: Anāpucchite anāpucchitasaññā āsane abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.1.eng: If she has not asked permission, and she does not perceive that she has, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.2.pli: Anāpucchite vematikā āsane abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.2.eng: If she has not asked permission, but she is unsure of it, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.3.pli: Anāpucchite āpucchitasaññā āsane abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.3.eng: If she has not asked permission, but she perceives that she has, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.4.eng: If it is not a place for sitting cross-legged, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.5.eng: If she has asked permission, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.6.eng: If she has asked permission, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.2.7.eng: If she has asked permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.2.pli: āpucchā āsane abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.2.eng: if she sits down or lies down after asking permission;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.3.eng: if a dedicated seat is permanently ready for her;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:2.3.8.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:0.4.eng: The subchapter on the dark of the night

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:0.5.eng: The training rule on spreading out without asking permission

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchantiyo sāyaṃ aññataraṃ gāmaṃ upagantvā aññataraṃ brāhmaṇakulaṃ upasaṅkamitvā okāsaṃ yāciṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.2.eng: At that time a number of nuns were traveling through the Kosalan country on their way to Sāvatthī, when one evening they arrived at a certain village. There they went to a brahmin family and asked for a place to stay.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.3.pli: Atha kho sā brāhmaṇī tā bhikkhuniyo etadavoca—

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.4.eng: “Please wait, Venerables, until my husband returns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.6.pli: “yāva brāhmaṇo āgacchatī”ti seyyaṃ santharitvā ekaccā nisīdiṃsu ekaccā nipajjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.6.eng: While they were waiting, the nuns put out bedding, and some sat down on it while others lay down.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.7.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo rattiṃ āgantvā taṃ brāhmaṇiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.7.eng: When the husband returned at night, he said to his wife,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.10.eng: “Throw out these shaven-headed sluts!”, and he had them thrown out of the house.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.11.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.11.eng: Those nuns then went to Sāvatthī, where they told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.12.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.12.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā abhinisīdissantipi abhinipajjissantipī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.13.eng: “How can nuns visit families at the wrong time, put out bedding without asking permission of the owners, and then sit down and lie down on it?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā abhinisīdantipi abhinipajjantipī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā abhinisīdissantipi abhinipajjissantipi.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.19.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.20.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a nun visits families at the wrong time, puts out bedding without asking permission of the owners, or has it put out, and then sits down or lies down on it, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.8.pli: cattāri kulāni— khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ suddakulaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.8.eng: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.11.eng: Without asking permission of the owners:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.12.pli: yo tasmiṃ kule manusso sāmiko dātuṃ, taṃ anāpucchā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.12.eng: not having asked permission of a person in that family who is an owner and who has the authority to give.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.18.eng: she has someone else to put it out.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.20.eng: if she sits down on it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.1.22.eng: if she lies down on it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.1.pli: Anāpucchite anāpucchitasaññā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.1.eng: If she has not asked permission, and she does not perceive that she has, and she sits down or lies down on bedding after putting it out or having it put out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.2.pli: Anāpucchite vematikā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.2.eng: If she has not asked permission, but she is unsure of it, and she sits down or lies down on bedding after putting it out or having it put out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.3.pli: Anāpucchite āpucchitasaññā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.3.eng: If she has not asked permission, but she perceives that she has, and she sits down or lies down on bedding after putting it out or having it put out, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.4.eng: If she has asked permission, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.5.eng: If she has asked permission, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.2.6.eng: If she has asked permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.3.2.pli: āpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdati vā abhinipajjati vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.3.2.eng: if she first asks permission, and then, after putting out bedding or having it put out, sits down or lies down on it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc17:2.3.7.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:0.4.eng: The subchapter on the dark of the night

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:0.5.eng: The training rule on complaining about others

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddāya kāpilāniyā antevāsinī bhikkhunī bhaddaṃ kāpilāniṃ sakkaccaṃ upaṭṭheti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.2.eng: At that time a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī attended on her with care.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.3.eng: Bhaddā Kāpilānī said to the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.4.pli: “ayaṃ maṃ, ayye, bhikkhunī sakkaccaṃ upaṭṭheti, imissāhaṃ cīvaraṃ dassāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.4.eng: “Venerables, this nun is attending on me with care. I’ll give her a robe.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.5.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.5.eng: Then, because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection, that nun complained about Bhaddā Kāpilānī,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.6.pli: “ahaṃ kirāyye, ayyaṃ na sakkaccaṃ upaṭṭhemi, na kira me ayyā cīvaraṃ dassatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.6.eng: “Venerables, if I didn’t attend on her with care, she wouldn’t give me a robe.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhunī duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.8.eng: “How could a nun complain about someone else because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.12.eng: “How could a nun act in this way?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun complains about someone else because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.7.eng: Because of a lack of proper reflection:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.10.eng: if she complains about one who is fully ordained, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives them as such, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive them as such, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.4.eng: If she complains about someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.5.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.3.3.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.3.4.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:0.4.eng: The subchapter on the dark of the night

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:0.5.eng: The training rule on cursing another

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo attano bhaṇḍakaṃ apassantiyo caṇḍakāḷiṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.2.eng: some nuns were unable to find their possessions. They said to the nun Caṇḍakāḷī,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.5.pli: “ahameva nūna corī, ahameva nūna alajjinī, yā ayyāyo attano bhaṇḍakaṃ apassantiyo tā maṃ evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.5.eng: “Why are you asking me if I’ve seen your things? Am I a thief? Am I shameless?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.7.pli: Sacāhaṃ, ayye, tumhākaṃ bhaṇḍakaṃ gaṇhāmi, assamaṇī homi, brahmacariyā cavāmi, nirayaṃ upapajjāmi;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.7.eng: Venerables, if I took your things I wouldn’t be a monastic anymore. I would fall from the spiritual life and be reborn in hell.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.8.pli: yā pana maṃ abhūtena evamāha sāpi assamaṇī hotu, brahmacariyā cavatu, nirayaṃ upapajjatū”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.8.eng: May anyone who speaks such an untruth about me depart from monasticism, fall from the spiritual life, and be reborn in hell!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.9.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.9.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā caṇḍakāḷī attānampi parampi nirayenapi brahmacariyenapi abhisapissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.10.eng: “How could Venerable Caṇḍakāḷī curse herself and others, referring to hell and the spiritual life?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.11.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī attānampi parampi nirayenapi brahmacariyenapi abhisapatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī attānampi parampi nirayenapi brahmacariyenapi abhisapissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.14.eng: “How could the nun Caṇḍakāḷī act like this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.16.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.17.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī attānaṃ vā paraṃ vā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a nun curses herself or someone else, referring to hell or the spiritual life, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.1.9.pli: Nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.1.9.eng: If she curses, referring to hell or the spiritual life, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives them as such, and she curses them, referring to hell or the spiritual life, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematikā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she curses them, referring to hell or the spiritual life, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive them as such, she curses them, referring to hell or the spiritual life, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.4.pli: Tiracchānayoniyā vā pettivisayena vā manussadobhaggena vā abhisapati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.4.eng: If she curses, referring to the animal realm, the ghost realm, or human misfortune, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.5.eng: If she curses someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.2.8.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.3.2.eng: if she is aiming at something beneficial;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.3.3.eng: if she is aiming at giving a teaching;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.3.4.eng: if she is aiming at giving an instruction;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc19:2.3.7.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:0.5.eng: The training rule on the hair of the private parts

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpetvā aciravatiyā nadiyā vesiyāhi saddhiṃ naggā ekatitthe nahāyanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns from the group of six removed the hair from their private parts. They then bathed naked at a ford in the river Aciravatī together with sex workers.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.3.eng: The sex workers complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpessanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns remove the hair from their private parts? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tāsaṃ vesiyānaṃ ujjhāyantīnaṃ khiyyantīnaṃ vipācentīnaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those sex workers,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six remove the hair from their private parts?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do that?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do that?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun removes hair from her private parts, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:2.8.eng: if she removes one hair, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:2.9.eng: Even if she removes many hairs, she commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:2.11.eng: if she does it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:2.13.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc2:2.14.eng: The second training rule is finished.
